Package jsgrewal.conwaysapi

Class DataStructure

  • java.lang.Object
    • jsgrewal.conwaysapi.DataStructure
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MemoryDataStructureInterface
    public class DataStructure
extends java.lang.Object
implements MemoryDataStructureInterface
    The DataStructure Class: Sparse Array Implementation Using Hashtable Data Structure

    Description: This data structure is used as base object in the Conway's Game of Life which only saves the cells which are alive. This implementation of saving only alive cells reduces the space used by objects by a very large extent and is a Sparse Matrix Implementation. For faster searching and fetching value, the DataStructure is implemented using Hashtables and the hash-collisions are prevented by implementing LinkedLists so that in case multiple values get assigned to the same key, the values will form a Linked List and thus, prevent hash collisions.

    Author:
    JSGREWAL 2019-03-07 Implemented Hashtable With LinkedList

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      DataStructure​(long height, long width)
      The basic constructor of the Data-Structure Object takes the height (number of rows) and width (number of cols) of the Hash-Table as parameters and set-up a hash-table of same dimensions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataStructure

        public DataStructure​(long height,
                     long width)
        The basic constructor of the Data-Structure Object takes the height (number of rows) and width (number of cols) of the Hash-Table as parameters and set-up a hash-table of same dimensions. This Hashtable is having {Row Index} as keys and {LinkedList of Column Indexes} as values. For example if the cells (2, 4), (2,5) and (3,7) are alive, then the following Hashtable will look like:
        The Sparse Matrix
        KeyValue
        2
        		LinkedList(4,5)
        3LinkedList(3)
        Parameters:
        height - Height (Number of Rows) of Hashtable
        width - Width (Number of Cols) of Hashtable

    • Method Detail

      • readDataStructure

        public boolean readDataStructure​(long row,
                                 long col)
        The readDataStructure routine takes the row and column index of a cell as input and tells if the cell is alive or not. According to the sparse-matrix implementation, if the cell is *present* in the cellIsAlive hash-table, then it is alive and if it is *absent* then it is dead.
        Specified by:
        readDataStructure in interface MemoryDataStructureInterface
        Parameters:
        row - The row index of cell
        col - The col index of cell
        Returns:
        True if Cell is Alive and False if Cell is not alive.

      • writeDataStructure

        public void writeDataStructure​(long row,
                               long col,
                               boolean isAlive)
        The writeDataStructure routine takes the row index, column index and boolean value telling if the input cell is alive and then inserts it to the cellIsAlive data-structure *if the cell is alive*. In case the cell is not alive, then according to the sparse-matrix implementation, it won't be part of this Hashtable.
        Specified by:
        writeDataStructure in interface MemoryDataStructureInterface
        Parameters:
        row - Row index of Cell
        col - Col index of Cell
        isAlive - True (Alive) or False (Dead)
